result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by September 23, 2022 and pay the surcharge by September 23, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by September 23, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Lynn Lenz

defendant.name: Lenz, Amanda Lynn

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Amanda Lynn Lenz.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Submit a DNA sample by September 23rd, 2022 and pay the surcharge by September 23rd, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by September 23, 2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Obscherning would like time to review discovery with his client and requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning has received discovery and an offer.  Defense is exploring a global resolution with defendant's felony case and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.M.M
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Amanda Lynn Lenz in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amanda Lynn Lenz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
